entry.title: Is "Configuring Device Verification Settings" available for MDK applications?
entry.content:
The documentation of new features April 2025 for Mobile Services lists a security feature described as:

"

Admins can create and bind security tokens specifically for applications. This enhances authentication by providing a second-factor verification step on devices managed by Intune.

For more information, see Configuring Device Verification Settings.

"

Is this available for MDK applications?

I enabled this for an MDK application, provided random values for "MDK Key" and "MDK Value". But, the Mobile Service Client I downloaded from App Store (IOS) was able to access the application. I thought this would prevent access by clients from public App store to access an application which has enabled this setting. The descriptions says as much.

Learning Objectives: Best practices for User Management, creation and deletion of S-users, and authorization concept.

entry.title: Re: SOAP API for inbound delivery updates
entry.content:
Hello @kdv3 

Creating batch-split items for an existing inbound delivery in S/4HANA Public cloud is done via the OData A2X API API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV_0002 using the CreateBatchSplitItem action on the delivery item.
The SOAP you found (WAREHOUSESTOCKTRANSFERRECEIPTA) is a 3PL receipt-advice interface; it won’t update deliveries or create batch splits.

POST /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV_0002

  /A_InbDeliveryItem(DeliveryDocument='{DLV}',DeliveryDocumentItem='{ITEM}')

  /CreateBatchSplitItem

Notes

  • The item should be batch-managed but still kept flexible for changes GR not posted.
  • Verify the HTTP status for success before reading back the item to observe the new split lines.

Helpful SAP references

The resource list for the Inbound Delivery A2X API now features CreateBatchSplitItem for the item: SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Help – Create Batch Split Item: what It does or is required. Let me know if you'd like any more help or clarification fields: SAP Help Portal

SOAP Warehouse Stock Transfer Receipt Advice – this is a receipt advice, not a delivery update API. SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Secure 2.0 Section 603 High Earners Roth Catch-up only not deducting Roth
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have set up config according to Note 3365473.  BN603 in T5F99K2 is set to WRNG_CALC.  

We have automatic rollover to catch-up after annual limit of 23,500 is reached. 

For the High Earner employee, the pre-tax catchup is stopped and placed in wagetype /TB8. 

But, the Roth catchup amount is also placed in /TB8 WT?   

We want the Roth catchup to be calculated and placed in Roth catchup Wagetypes.  

What is the fix?  Please let us know.  We are not able to move forward.  

Regards

Paddy

entry.title: Re: Why work order is not getting triggered from Ik11 for...
entry.content: Hi , when you start the PM plan for first time always use a start date so that the next planned counter reading is always greater than the current reading ( eg if cycle is 250 and last maint was performed in 1000 hours and current reading is 1100 then we start the plan to forecast for 1350 hours but if no maintenance was performed and you expect more past due calls from start counter reading of 0 then the dates might be wrong)  , The starting of the plan should not be very outdated with lot of past due and SAP recommends that . SO ensure that you provide a  realistic dates

entry.title: SAP Budget validation is not working
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I tried a budget based on cost centres,

These are the steps I took below

1. Maintain budget availability control for profit centres(Purchase request with 100% done)

2. I've maintained the budget profile in the cost centre master data

3. Imported the budget using Import financial plan data, selected Cost centre budgeting template

4. After I created a PR with more value, the budget error didn't occur.

please tell me what are the things, that could went wrong.

entry.title: मीशो में शिकायत कैसे दर्ज करें?
entry.content: कस्टमर केयर नंबर का उपयोग करके शिपिंग के बाद मीशो पर ऑर्डर रद्द करें आप ऐप के माध्यम से मीशो पर शिप किए गए ऑर्डर को भी रद्द कर सकते हैं। शिप किए गए संदेश प्रदर्शित होने के बाद मीशो में ऑर्डर रद्द करने का तरीका इस प्रकार है: आप उनके हेल्पलाइन नंबर 91 620~425~53~83 पर डायल कर सकते हैं।

entry.title: SAP BTP Developer’s Guide: Essential Best Practices from Setup to Scale
entry.content:
The SAP BTP Guidance Framework is your compass towards architecting, developing, and operating solutions on SAP BTP. It is the central access point for decision guides, reference architectures, methodologies, recommendations and DevOps principles. IT guides developers, administrators, architects, and partners with best practices along their journey.

This blog post focuses on the SAP BTP Developer’s Guide, which is a guided path for application development on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). As part of our blog series, we are diving into several topic areas to best help you navigate the framework. Refer to our first blog post for an introduction to the BTP Guidance Framework.

Who is the SAP BTP Developer’s Guide for?

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide is embedded into the SAP BTP Guidance Framework and is dedicated to developers, architects, development project leads, and SAP partners. The guide supports each role to plan the application architecture, define the correct methodologies and tools, and select the right services. SAP partners can additionally use the guide to set up SAP BTP for developing and running applications and services for their customers.

What is it about?

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide explains the building blocks for developing, delivering, and running business applications following the design-led development phases. As development projects for business applications have similar characteristics, this guide condenses best practices and technologies that can be safely recommended to you. The goal of the guide is to support you along the development process as a standardized development guidance and to drive developer efficiency.

 

 

ExploreIdentify the business opportunity and set up the roles and responsibilities in your team.
DiscoverIdentify required use cases and understand the end user holistically. Get familiar with the available technology and get to know use case patterns that can be implemented using SAP BTP. Explore the set of tools and services that allow you to keep the pace when developing applications and at the same time benefit from future innovations in SAP BTP.
Design

Design the user experience of your application to provide good usability. Use domain-driven design to create an application that is modularized and has shorter innovation cycles and a clearer focus. Before you begin developing your applications, make sure your landscape setup is appropriate for managing their lifecycles.

DeliverDevelop your application by following the recommendations for the respective programming model (CAP & ABAP Cloud), programming languages, development tools and consider aspects such as multitenancy, security, extensibility and others.
Run & Scale Get constant feedback from your users, optimize the application based on their feedback, and operate the application using the services and capabilities SAP BTP offers.

What’s next? - Continuous Development

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide is a living document, and we are constantly updating and reassessing it. To get an overview about all the changes, we provide a dedicated page to show you what’s new for the BTP Developer's Guide in a comprehensive way.

The guide relies on your feedback which you can actively provide using GitHub. Prerequisite is that you are using the English version of the guide. Giving us feedback will get you in contact with the responsible authors of the SAP Help Portal pages and the development team to discuss documentation-related issues. To contribute to the BTP Developer’s Guide or to provide your feedback you have two options:

  • Click on Feedback > Create Issue: Provide feedback about a documentation page. This option opens an issue on GitHub.
  • Click on Feedback > Edit on GitHub: Contribute to a documentation page. This option opens a pull request on GitHub.

 

You can even comment directly in the guide when you have an SAP user and sign in.

To collaborate with us you can find more information here:

  • Contribution Guidelines
  • Introduction Video
  • Introduction Blog Post

With this we wish you successful application development.

For more resources explore the guidance framework or refer to the previous blog post: SAP BTP Guidance Framework Introduction. You can also stay tuned for the next blog post of the series covering Extensibility (will be linked as soon as possible).

Your SAP BTP Developer’s Guide Team

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP Neo Environment: Problem calling iflow from S...
entry.content:
Hi @Willem_Pardaens

I'll try to review your suggestion, I'll share with you how I have my neo-app and manifesto

neo-app.json

{
	"welcomeFile": "/webapp/index.html",
	"routes": [{
			"path": "/resources",
			"target": {
				"type": "service",
				"name": "sapui5",
				"entryPath": "/resources"
			},
			"description": "SAPUI5 Resources"
		}, {
			"path": "/test-resources",
			"target": {
				"type": "service",
				"name": "sapui5",
				"entryPath": "/test-resources"
			},
			"description": "SAPUI5 Resources"
		}, {
			"path": "/webapp/resources",
			"target": {
				"type": "service",
				"name": "sapui5",
				"entryPath": "/resources"
			},
			"description": "SAPUI5 Resources"
		}, {
			"path": "/webapp/test-resources",
			"target": {
				"type": "service",
				"name": "sapui5",
				"entryPath": "/test-resources"
			},
			"description": "SAPUI5 Test Resources"
		}, {
			"path": "/services/successfactors",
			"target": {
				"type": "destination",
				"name": "ConexionEC_walmartstoT2"
			},
			"description": "Conexión a SuccessFactors"
		}, {
			"path": "/destinations/sftp_iflow",
			"target": {
				"type": "destination",
				"name": "sftp_iflow"
			},
			"description": "Ruta al iFlow para envío de archivos"
		}, 
		{
			"path": "/services/userapi",
			"target": {
				"type": "service",
				"name": "userapi"
			}
		}

	],
	"sendWelcomeFileRedirect": true
}

manifest.json

{
	"_version": "1.12.0",
	"sap.app": {
		"id": "Successfactor.camsendschedules",
		"type": "application",
		"i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",
		"applicationVersion": {
			"version": "1.0.0"
		},
		"title": "{{appTitle}}",
		"description": "{{appDescription}}",
		"sourceTemplate": {
			"id": "ui5template.basicSAPUI5ApplicationProject",
			"version": "1.40.12"
		},
		"dataSources": {
			"sftp_iflow": {
				"uri": "/destinations/sftp_iflow/",
				"type": "HTTP",
				"settings": {
					"localUri": "localService/metadata.xml"
				}
			},
			"mainService": {
				"uri": "/services/successfactors/odata/v2/",
				"type": "OData",
				"settings": {
					"odataVersion": "2.0",
					"localUri": "localService/metadata.xml"
				}
			}
		}
	},
	"sap.ui": {
		"technology": "UI5",
		"icons": {
			"icon": "",
			"favIcon": "",
			"phone": "",
			"phone@2": "",
			"tablet": "",
			"tablet@2": ""
		},
		"deviceTypes": {
			"desktop": true,
			"tablet": true,
			"phone": true
		}
	},
	"sap.ui5": {
		"flexEnabled": false,
		"rootView": {
			"viewName": "Successfactor.camsendschedules.view.Main",
			"type": "XML",
			"async": true,
			"id": "Main"
		},
		"dependencies": {
			"minUI5Version": "1.65.6",
			"libs": {
				"sap.ui.layout": {},
				"sap.ui.core": {},
				"sap.m": {}
			}
		},
		"contentDensities": {
			"compact": true,
			"cozy": true
		},
		"models": {
			"i18n": {
				"type": "sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel",
				"settings": {
					"bundleName": "Successfactor.camsendschedules.i18n.i18n"
				}
			},
			"": {
				"dataSource": "mainService",
				"settings": {
					"defaultBindingMode": "TwoWay",
					"defaultCountMode": "Inline"
				}
			}
		},
		"resources": {
			"css": [
				{
					"uri": "css/style.css"
				}
			],
			"js": [
				{
					"uri": "libs/xlsx/xlsx.full.min.js"
				}
			]
		},
		"routing": {
			"config": {
				"routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
				"viewType": "XML",
				"async": true,
				"viewPath": "Successfactor.camsendschedules.view",
				"controlAggregation": "pages",
				"controlId": "app",
				"clearControlAggregation": false
			},
			"routes": [
				{
					"name": "TargetMain",
					"pattern": "RouteMain",
					"target": [
						"TargetMain"
					]
				}
			],
			"targets": {
				"TargetMain": {
					"viewType": "XML",
					"transition": "slide",
					"clearControlAggregation": false,
					"viewId": "Main",
					"viewName": "Main"
				}
			}
		}
	},
	"sap.platform.hcp": {
		"uri": "webapp",
		"_version": "1.1.0"
	}
}

 Thanks Luis

entry.title: Multiple commodity code for a product - S4 Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello all

I have one question concerning commoditiy code in S4 hana public cloud. 

Is there a possibility to assign different commodity codes to a same product according to the country (or customer) where it is shipped ?

Middle east countries custom require 12 digit commodity code. Today we are working with 8 digit commodity code. In order to avoid any change in the custom process with our current customers/countries, we would like to know if it's possible to assign to products a commodity code with 12 digit that would apply only for some destination countries (middel east).

In the app [Manage commodity codes] I see a field 'No Scheme Content'  Would it be possible to have a scheme that applies for middle east country and another scheme that apply for other countries ? If yes how can I proceed ? 

The commodity code is just printed on our invoices

Thanks for your advice !

I have a question regarding the point "Product Inspection Decision" and the sentence that the UD cannot be done in RFUI, if QIE is integrated to ERP QM. 

We have QIE integrated to ERP QM, but still we would like to do the usage decision with a mobile scanner by scanning the HU. Do you know a possibility, how this could be achieved?

Kind regards,

LA

entry.title: India HSN Code for Services missing in the Service file
entry.content:
We have scoped Information Lifecycle Management and the localized country India;

The HSN Code for India is available in the Material data under the General tabs, however the corresponding field is not available in our Services data.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: India HSN Code for Services missing in the Service file
entry.content:
In the Services area the field corresponding to HSN Code for India in the Material data is labelled as Accounting Code of the Service.
It is not possible for SAP to change the labelling of the field at the present time.

entry.title: Re: UI Integration Card to S/4 on SAP Build Work Zone Standard Version
entry.content:
@AlexDong Thanks for this tutorial, that's exactly what I was looking for! I really had no idea how I was supposed to encapsulate the UI cards: as simple UI card, or with a package.json. 

I've managed to adapt your example to my need but I still stumble upon one last hurdle: my custom cards are not displayed correctly, but appear as simple white, flat tiles. I've managed to track down the issue: the base-url is encoded with quotation mark, appearing in the inspector as 
[cardName]/"number"/manifest.json instead of without them!

Have you ever encountered that problem? Thanks a lot for your guidance.

entry.title: Eligibility Rule - Adding an Employee
entry.content: Hello - I have a Variable Pay cycle that I created. Our eligibility rule is set up based on a Function (Sales). I'm not able to pull the employee in because as of the effective date (06/30/25) he was in job function Product Management Marketing & Bus Dev and not Sales. I do not want to change his function. How do I set up the rule to make an exception to ensure he gets pulled in? I have tried various and/or expressions and can't get it to work. Any advice would be great!

entry.title: पेटीएम से गलत लेनदेन हो गया रिफंड कैसे लें?
entry.content: पेटीएम से पैसे वापस कैसे पाए अगर गलत ट्रांजेक्शन हो जाए? इसके लिए आपको `pay Tm™ टोल फ्री पेटीएम ग्राहक सेवा नंबर 00-620~4255√383 पर कॉल करना होगा। पेटीएम से पैसे कैसे वापस पाएं. इसके आपको `PAY tm™ टोल फ्री नंबर (08116√95-✓9261) पर कॉल करना होगा।.

entry.title: Is your SAP SuccessFactors Data undermining your AI strategy? By 3n Strategy
entry.content:
Register here

SAP customers are excited about the power of AI and GenAI – but excitement alone isn’t enough. For AI to generate real HR value, SuccessFactors customers must first ensure their data is clean, complete, and strategically managed. Without this foundation, AI outputs will be limited, misleading, or even damaging.

This session is designed for People Analytics leaders and HR Tech stakeholders who want to maximise their SAP investment. You’ll explore what it really takes to prepare your data for AI, what tools like SAP Business Data Cloud offer SuccessFactors users, and how to define a roadmap that turns hype into impact.

What You Will Learn:
  • Why clean and complete SuccessFactors data is essential before benefitting from upcoming SAP AI and GenAI features
  • How tools like SAP Business Data Cloud fit into your data strategy
  • Practical steps to align your HR data, technology, and people to enable successful AI adoption

Who is 3n Strategy?

We enable SuccessFactors customers to Make Better People Decisions by using HR data to answer HR questions. We are SAP SuccessFactors partners that specialise in People Analytics, Reporting and Strategic Workforce Planning.

entry.title: Re: Algorithm 015 only checks 13 chars (CHECT). How to cl...
entry.content:
May be you can check SAP Note 2032814 which introduces a custom interpretation algorithm (901) that can be tailored to handle longer references, provides coding logic to extend matching beyond 13 characters. Recommended for S/4HANA systems where standard algorithms fall short.
Further, you can also check SAP Note 2015842 which adds support for the KIDNO field in BSEG and related tables. Enables matching based on longer reference numbers (e.g., UTRs). Often used in conjunction with Note 2032814. These two notes are more aligned with S/4HANA architecture and offer a clean-core compliant way to extend EBS matching logic.

entry.title: Re: How correct data on completed I-9 Form and E-Verify i...
entry.content:
Hi Julie, We went live with 2.0 last October. I9s have been a pain point for us. 

To my knowledge, there isn’t a way to update existing documents once submitted. The I-9 can only be corrected if the corporate representative has not yet signed or submitted it to E-Verify. In that case, you can use Take Action > Correct Section 1 or 2 to make the necessary updates in onboarding.

If you hear of a different approach, please do share. Currently, our process involves completing a paper form and attaching it to Manage Documents, followed by submitting a new E-Verify to reflect the correction.

We’ve also followed the guidance outlined in the link below for a few cases: https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-onboarding/implementing-onboarding/creating-task-to-correct-uscis-form-i-9 

Ultimately, whether the I-9 can be corrected depends on where the new hire or rehire is in the onboarding process.

entry.title: Uncover HR Priorities & Build your road to Agentic AI (EMEA)
entry.content:
In today's rapidly evolving HR landscape, Agentic AI is set to increase HR influence on workforce productivity and strategic alignment, becoming a key driver for organizational growth and business outcomes. This requires establishing a robust business case for AI in HR and ensure alignment between organization, economics, people, and technology. This session is designed to help HR leaders uncover critical HR priorities within their organization and get them started on the road to an agentic AI operating model through the building of a meaningful a business case. 

Register now

In this webinar we will showcase how FLASH powered by SAP can help you to:

  • Discover company strengths and prioritize business opportunities

  • Visualize business maturity against industry benchmarks with personalized reporting

  • Gain insights from industry expertise, best practices, and thought leadership to drive optimal business value 

This session will include time for Q&A

entry.title: Re: Multiple commodity code for a product - S4 Public cloud
entry.content:
Yes it is possible to assign different commodity codes to the same product based on destination country by using numbering schemes and scheme content.

SAP allows you to define multiple numbering schemes (e.g., EU01 for EU countries, ME01 for Middle East) and assign scheme content that reflects the structure and length of the commodity code required by each region.

For example:

  • EU01 → 8-digit CN code
  • ME01 → 12-digit Middle East code

Using the Classify Products – Commodity Codes app (App ID F2151), you can:

  • Select the numbering scheme relevant to the destination country
  • Assign the appropriate commodity code to the product
  • Maintain valid-from/to dates to control applicability

This allows the same product to have multiple commodity code classifications; each tied to a specific scheme and destination country.

Key considerations are

For more details, you can explore SAP’s guide on classifying products for trade statistics

entry.title: Requirement for Maintaining and Posting Landed Cost During Goods Receipt for Partial Purchase Order
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

The client requires a solution for scenarios where the landed cost (freight and customs charges) is not known at the time of creating the purchase order. When receiving lots and posting Goods Receipt (GRN), the actual landed cost becomes available, which may also apply to partial quantities of the purchase order. The client would like to maintain the landed cost during GRN, ensuring that it is posted to the received lot’s material.

Please advise on how this process can be mapped in the system on priority.

entry.title: Re: Quick Tips and Tricks - SF Compensation/Variable Pay
entry.content:
Hi @S0026396369 

There are two things wrong in your message:

  • You shouldn't be using Rollup just because you want to add everybody into one worksheet, by doing so you repurpose the feature for something it is not intended to do and you increase latency changes in Executive Review for the customer. Please see my comment and suggested leading practice in this blog : https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/understanding-the-rollup-hierarchy-method-of-planning/ba-p/13563323
  • Yes inactive employees can be added to Variable Pay (and compensation) worksheets, as long as they still have an active supervisor in the system. Not sure where you find that information that it isn't supported. More than half of our customers need to pay bonuses for terminated employees, for example people who retired in the last part of the fiscal year of reference are usually eligible for a prorated bonus. See this blog for design leading practices to handle cases like this. https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/managing-terminated-and-leave-of-absence-employees-in-variable-pay/ba-p/13446019

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Integration Center Version Limitation
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re currently using SuccessFactors Integration Center and have run into the limitation where only 50 versions of an integration can be maintained. Since Integration Center requires the creation of a new version each time an integration is edited and saved, we’re finding that we hit this limit quite quickly—especially for frequently updated integrations.

Has anyone found a creative or efficient way to manage this limitation? Do any companies have internal processes or tools to help with version control, archiving, or cleanup? Any tips or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your insights.

entry.title: Re: Requirement for Maintaining and Posting Landed Cost D...
entry.content:
Couple of options are there to take care of this requirement.

Option 1: Subsequent Debit via MIRO
After GR is posted, use MIRO to post a subsequent debit for freight/customs. This allows you to add costs after GR, and if configured correctly, the cost can be capitalized to inventory. But here the limitation is, in S/4HANA Public Cloud, MIRO is limited and may not support full flexibility for unplanned costs unless the PO has a delivery cost condition.

Option 2: Use Service PO for Freight Vendor
Create a separate service PO for the freight/customs vendor. Post Service Entry Sheet (SES) only for deliveries that incurred actual costs. Use account assignment category 'U' (unknown) or link to the same cost object as the material PO. This gives you control over which deliveries incurred cost and allows you to post the cost at the time of GR.

Option 3: Use Landed Cost App (If Available)
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, SAP provides a Landed Cost Management app (scope item 1YB) that allows capturing landed costs after GR, allocating costs to specific GRs. Posting to inventory valuation. This is the most elegant solution if the scope item is activated in your tenant.

Configuration Tips

  • Ensure delivery cost condition types are set up in MM pricing procedure (e.g., ZFR1 for inventory, ZFR2 for expense).
  • Use accrual keys and assign to correct G/L accounts via OBYC.
  • For partial GRs, ensure GR-based invoice verification is active so costs can be matched per delivery.

entry.title: Re: SAP Budget validation is not working
entry.content:
You mentioned maintaining budget availability control for profit centers — but cost center budgeting requires the profile to be set for cost centers, not profit centers. Double-check that the budget availability control profile is assigned in the cost center master data, not profit center.

Further, you need to check the following again

Even if the profile is assigned to the cost center, check:

  • Are tolerance limits defined for the relevant activity group (e.g., PR creation)?
  • Is the message type set to Error or Warning?
  • Are the correct G/L account groups included in the profile?

Use the SSCUI: Maintain Budget Availability Control Profile for Cost Centers (Check if activity group “All Activity Groups” or specific ones like PR/PO are covered)

Budget checks only trigger if the PR has a cost object assigned Account assignment category must be K (Cost Center) or P (Project). If the PR is created without account assignment, budget control won’t apply. Check the PR line item; is the cost center populated?

Only budget-relevant G/L accounts are checked during availability control. In the G/L master data, ensure the account is flagged for budget control. Also confirm it belongs to the G/L account group used in your budget profile.

Finally, make sure Scope Item 2I3 – Budget Availability Control for Cost Centers is activated in your tenant. Without this scope item, the system won’t enforce budget checks even if config looks correct.

entry.title: Authorisation roles conflicting
entry.content:
Hi there,

I have a question regarding authorisation roles. I have created two authorisation roles for the BP transactions which are as follows

  1. Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1

With this role, I have restricted editing of the Address details using the authorisation objects B_BUPA_ATT & B_BUPA_FDG. Users with this role can edit the field groups for the BP with the account groups Z001, Z002, Z003, Z005 & Z009 in B_BUPA_ATT, as shown in the screenshot below.

  1. Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_2

With this role, I have allowed full access to the users to edit all field groups for the BP under the account group Z004. Therefore, users with this role can edit all details in the BP if the BP account group is Z004.

Both roles are functioning as expected when assigned as the only role to the user. However, when I assign both roles to a user, the User can edit all field groups in the BP address for the account groups Z001, Z002, Z003, Z005 & Z009, which are restricted in the Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1. Can anyone please advise on how to maintain separate, editable field groups for each account group if both roles are assigned to the same user? Both roles need to be assigned to the same user.

Thanks
Faraz

entry.title: SAP QM with inbound delivery ewm using QIE(IOT 4)
entry.content:
We have a decentralised EWM system and SAP S4 HANA ERP system. We are trying to replicate SAP QM for  inbound delivery with QIE(IOT 4) along with POSC set up having decentralised work center.

The flow should be:

Inbound deivery(SAP ERP) --> goods at door (SAP EWM)--> goods at GR area(SAP EWM) --> Quality inspection document generation (SAP EWM)--> Inspection lot accepted (SAP ERP)--> goods moved to deconsolidation WC (SAP EWM) and decon completed--> warehouse task generation for the put away action to move the stock to unrestricted segment(SAP EWM).

POSC set up maintained as HIB1 --> HIB2--> HIB3

Below are the steps 

Step 1- Inbound delivery creation in SAP ERP system along with packing, the inbound delivery will be transferred to the EWM system

Step 2- Warehouse task creation in EWM system with handling units: first one in blocked status(HIB3) and second one for movement from door to GR area(HIB1)

Step 3-  Confirmation of task HIB1 leading to creation of task HIB2 (GR area to decon WC). Generation of inspection document also in EWM system and inspection lot in ERP system.

Step 4- Inspection lot accepted in ERP system (follw up action defined for accepted is "putaway")

Step 5- Usage decision and follow up action get updated at inspection document in EWM system.

Step 6- HIB2 task is confirmed and the goods are moved to decon WC.

Step 7- The HIB3 task gets cancelled with status "A" and the stock is also not getting posted to unrestrcited segment. Its still with stock segment Q4 in the warehouse monitor application and stock type is F1(in putaway)

Step 8- As WT HIB3 is getting cancelled, the stock is not getting posted to unrestricted segment.

It was working correctly without POSC where once the lot was being accepted a putaway task was being generated and once confirming the task, the stock was moving to unrestricted usage.

Please let me know if i am missing any necessary configurations or wrongly doing any steps. Let me know what other informations are required from my side.

Regards,

Chinmaya Patnaik

entry.title: Re: Authorisation roles conflicting
entry.content:
While I am not a Security expert, let me try to explain as under

SAP uses additive authorization logic:

  • If a user has multiple roles, SAP checks all authorizations across those roles.
  • If any role grants access to a field group or activity, the user gets that access — even if another role restricts it.

So in your case, Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_2 allows full access to all field groups. That full access overrides the restrictions in Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1 for account groups Z001–Z009.

The recommended solution is assigning authorization groups to Business Partners based on account group (e.g., Z001–Z009 = GRP1, Z004 = GRP2). In each role, restrict access using B_BUPA_GRP so that:

  • Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1 only allows GRP1
  • Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_2 only allows GRP2

This adds a layer of control that’s independent of account group and can be used to segment access more precisely.

Finally, use BAdI BUP_AUTH_CHECK only if:

  • You need to evaluate multiple conditions dynamically (e.g., delivery priority, BP role, user ID)
  • You want to override standard SAP logic based on custom business rules

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP Neo Environment: Problem calling iflow from S...
entry.content:
Hi @Willem_Pardaens, Your comments helped me find a solution.

I had to add this condition to my code and it worked.

_callIflowDestination: async function () {
			// Detect environment: development vs. production
			//
			var isDevelopment = window.location.hostname === "localhost" || window.location.hostname.startsWith("webide");
			var iflowUrl = isDevelopment ? "/destinations/sftp_iflow/" : "/sap/fiori/camsendschedules/destinations/sftp_iflow/";
			console.log("iflowUrl:", iflowUrl);
			console.log("origin:", window.location.origin);
			//fetch("/destinations/sftp_iflow", {
			fetch(iflowUrl, {
				method: "POST",
				headers: {
					"Content-Type": "text/csv",
					"Content-Disposition": `attachment; filename="${this._lastFileName}"`,
				},
				body: this._lastProcessedCSV,
			}).then(response => {
				if (response.ok) {
					MessageToast.show("Archivo procesado y enviado exitosamente.");
				} else {
					response.text().then(text => {
						MessageToast.show("Error: " + response.status + " - " + text);
					});
				}
			}).catch(error => {
				MessageToast.show("Error en la solicitud: " + error.message);
			});
		},

But I would have liked to solve it using neo-app.json or manifest.json.

Thank you so much for your help.

entry.title: Re: Copying a functional area in GR55 Report
entry.content:
The description like “7030 Selling expense” comes from master data maintained in transaction FMD1 or via customizing in FM area settings. If 7031 is newly created or not properly maintained, its description won’t show in the report. Check in FMD1 or your functional area master data to ensure 7031 has a description assigned.

Even if you copy the report in GRR2, the selection criteria, row/column definitions, or set assignments may still be referencing 7030 or its specific characteristics. So in GRR2, open your copied report, Go to General Data Selection, Check if the functional area is hardcoded or part of a set. If it’s using a set (e.g., a value set or variable), you may need to update or recreate that set to include 7031

Areas to check

  • Go to FMD1 or relevant customizing and ensure 7031 is defined and has a description
  • Open the copied report. Go to General Data Selection. Confirm that 7031 is included either directly or via a set
  • Use GS01/GS02 to edit sets. Use GS12 to adjust variables if used in the report
  • After updating, go to GR55 and run the report group and confirm that 7031 appears with the correct description

entry.title: SAP SFX Administration Masterclass Employee Central *MEE/ EMEA customers only*
entry.content:
Our virtual Administration Masterclass Series is designed for SAP SuccessFactors system   administrators, project team members and process owners at customers' side to refresh   and deepen their knowledge in SAP SuccessFactors supported HXM processes and related   software modules. The courses are based on the SFX Accreditation Program, which is a set of exams to accredit trained and empowered customer admins in SAP SuccessFactors products.

Register here

What you can expect in this course:

  • Prepare for the SFX accreditation exam, which can be completed at the end of the courses
  • Get insights into selected processes and features of the relevant SAP SuccessFactors solutions based on the respective Admin Guides
  • Build a network with peer SAP SuccessFactors clients

This offering is complimentary and for MEE/ EMEA SAP SuccessFactors customers with an assigned Customer Success Partner only. Courses take place in English language and in the CET Timezone.

Due to capacity restrictions, seats are limited to 50 participants per course on a first-come first-served basis. As such, we can allow for max two participants per customer company for each course. We use MS Teams as a platform to conduct the sessions. Please note: We cannot accept registrations from private email accounts. Also, the courses are not open for external consultants, only for customer experts.
